header.name: chaos/preprocessor/config.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines library configuration macros.

macro.abstract: The macro determines whether the library supports C99/C++0x facilities such as variadic macros and placemarkers.

usage.param: The value that determines whether variadics and placemarkers are supported.

macro.para: This macro defaults to 1 if the preprocessor is a C99 preprocessor. Otherwise, it defaults to 0.

This macro may be defined by the user prior to the inclusion of any library headers to explicitly enable or disable the use of variadics and placemarkers in the library. If this macro is defined by the user, the library redefines it such that it expands to either 0 or 1. If it is defined by the user with an empty replacement list or is defined as non-zero, the library redefines it as 1. Otherwise, the library redefines it as 0.
If the user defines this macro as an expression (as opposed to a number), the expression should be enclosed in parentheses to avoid interference with the redefinition process. #define (A + B)
This macro may further be used in user code to distinguish between variadic macro and placemarker support and the lack thereof.
